review: It's just worth 35 bucks.. not 50. Works great with youtube. But nothing else is as good. With older laptop the casting video is a painful experience (but mirroring a website is just fine). In addition it does not work with corporate laptop, as antivirus on the work laptop will block it. Finally it only works on 2.4 Ghz. So if you don't have a dual mode router, you have to configure the router to 2.4 Ghz only, that means lyou won't get benefit of 5.0 GHz if your mobile device supports it. Google needs to improve a bunch of things on this device, but one thing is certain you will have the best Youtube experience with this device. If you watch Youtube a lot, it's worth the money for sure.

review: There weren't that many options for the chromecast when it came out.  And now even tho many apps have caught up and are offering the option to stream, the reliability is still suspect.  Halfway while playing it can just disconnect.  In addition if you use plex or even just get a video with AC3 or DTS you can't get any 5.1, it all goes down to 2.0 channels...  They keep saying in the future but... but here is the catch, the device is awesome, for 35 bucks and being able to throw up a browser tab is indispensable!
